bug.author: serrodcal
bug.summary: Misleading message trying to download non-existing model
bug.description:
I get a misleading error executing the following script code: <denchmark-code>from spacy.es import Spanish
nlp = Spanish(path=None)
doc = nlp(u'Hola esto es una prueba de la librer√≠a Spacy en Espa√±ol.') sentence = next(doc.sents) </denchmark-code>
After that, the error tells me to download a non-existing model, as it is shown below: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "spacy/tokens/doc.pyx", line 434, in __get__ (spacy/tokens/doc.cpp:9664) ValueError: sentence boundary detection requires the dependency parse, which requires data to be installed. If you haven't done so, run: python -m spacy download es to install the data </denchmark-code>
Running python -m spacy download es in command line the message tell me es does not existing as model: <denchmark-code>$ python -m spacy download es
Compatibility error
No compatible model found for 'es' (spaCy v1.8.2). </denchmark-code>
SpaCy should have checked for available models, or simply pointed to the models documentation instead. <denchmark-h:h2>My Environment</denchmark-h>
Python version: 2.7.13 Platform: Darwin-16.5.0-x86_64-i386-64bit spaCy version: 1.8.2 Installed models:

comments.comment: Thanks for the report ‚Äì this will definitely be fixed in the next version! üëç (Also, as I mentioned on <denchmark-link:http://stackoverflow.com/questions/43918886/error-downloading-spanish-model-in-spacy/43922477#comment74896955_43922477>StackOverflow</denchmark-link> , the <denchmark-link:https://spacy.io/docs/api/language-models>language models docs</denchmark-link> should probably be more explicit about what "alpha support" really means, i.e. that it refers to the tokenizer and class and not to alpha models etc. I think even renaming the section to "Languages" and adding a note to the alpha section will help here. Will update this as well!)

even while downloading language models for english language I get the same error
python -m spacy download 'en_depent_web_md'
<denchmark-code>Compatibility error
No compatible model found for ''en_depent_web_md'' (spaCy v1.9.0). </denchmark-code>

Has this been fixed in spaCy 1.9.0? I just got this error: $ python -m spacy download en_vectors_web_lg <denchmark-code>Compatibility error
No compatible model found for 'en_vectors_web_lg' (spaCy v1.9.0). </denchmark-code>
Not sure where the compatibility applies - where do I look?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/colingoldberg>@colingoldberg</denchmark-link> spaCy's command fetches the compatibility table from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spacy-models/blob/master/compatibility.json>spacy-models/compatibility.json</denchmark-link> . It seems like the model you're looking for is (which was renamed to in v2.0+ for consistency).
Thanks for your response. I have upgraded to the latest spaCy version, and with a 'python -m spacy download en' it seems to be ok.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
